Datastructures.Clauses

Class Clause

  • java.lang.Object
    • Datastructures.Clauses.Clause

  • public class Clause
extends java.lang.Object
    A clause is just a list of CLiterals. Created by ohlbach on 13.09.2018.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      java.util.ArrayList<CLiteral> cliterals
      the literals

      for identifying the clause

      indicates if the clause is an input clause or not

      for sorting clauses, for example in a listPosition queue

      compares clauses accoding to their listPosition
      boolean removed
      indicates that the clause has been removed
      static java.util.Comparator<Clause> sizeComparator
      compares clauses according to their length
      int timestamp
      a timestamp to be used by corresponding algorithms

        checks if the clause is empty

      • contains

        public int contains(int literal)
        checks if the literal is in the clause
        Parameters:
        literal - a literal
        Returns:
        the literal's position in the clause, or -1

      • addCLiteral

        public int addCLiteral(CLiteral cliteral)
        adds a cliteral to the end of the clause
        double literals and tautologies are avoided.
        Parameters:
        cliteral - the literal to be added.
        Returns:
        +1 if the literal is already in the clause, -1 if -literal is in the clause, otherwise 0.

      • addCLiteralDirectly

        public void addCLiteralDirectly(CLiteral cliteral)
        adds a cliteral to the end of the clause, without checking for double literals and tautologies.
        Parameters:
        cliteral - the literal to be added.

      • removeLiteral

        public void removeLiteral(CLiteral cLiteral)
        removes a cliteral from the clause.
        Parameters:
        cLiteral - the literal to be removed.

      • removeLiteralAtPosition

        public void removeLiteralAtPosition(int position)
        removes a cliteral at the given position from the clause.
        Parameters:
        position - the position of the literal to be removed

      • isSubset

        public boolean isSubset(CLiteral cLiteral,
                        Clause clause2)
        checks if the literals in this, except cLiteral also occur in clause2
        Parameters:
        cLiteral - a cLiteral in 'this'
        clause2 - any other clause
        Returns:
        true if the literals in this, except cLiteral also occur in clause2
